title: What you learn by making a new programming language
dot: digraph G{node[shape=box, style="rounded, filled", fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=10, color="#FFFFFF", fillcolor="#f0f0f0", width=2.5];main[label="Why Make a Programming Language?", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#A7C7E7", color="#A7C7E7", fontcolor="#333333"];tool_1[label="Learn about Grammars & Language Design", shape=box, fillcolor="#B5E0D0", color="#B5E0D0"];tool_2[label="Learn about Parsing", shape=box, fillcolor="#B5E0D0", color="#B5E0D0"];tool_3[label="Learn about Runtime Execution", shape=box, fillcolor="#B5E0D0", color="#B5E0D0"];tool_4[label="Gain Intuition for Other Languages", shape=box, fillcolor="#B5E0D0", color="#B5E0D0"];tool_5[label="It's Okay to Make a Bad Language", shape=box, fillcolor="#FFDDC1", color="#FFDDC1"];tool_6[label="Fun & Targeted Learning", shape=box, fillcolor="#FFDDC1", color="#FFDDC1"];main->tool_1;main->tool_2;main->tool_3;main->tool_4;main->tool_5;main->tool_6;insight_1[label="Making a Language = Close to the Machine", shape=box, fillcolor="#F9D423", color="#F9D423"];insight_2[label="Learn by Implementing Other's Language", shape=box, fillcolor="#F9D423", color="#F9D423"];insight_3[label="Build Tools From Scratch: A Programmer's Privilege", shape=box, fillcolor="#F9D423", color="#F9D423"];tool_1->insight_1;tool_3->insight_2;tool_4->insight_3;resource_1[label="Crafting Interpreters (Rust)", shape=box, fillcolor="#E9CBA7", color="#E9CBA7"];resource_2[label="Writing An Interpreter In Go", shape=box, fillcolor="#E9CBA7", color="#E9CBA7"];resource_3[label="Build Your Own Lisp", shape=box, fillcolor="#E9CBA7", color="#E9CBA7"];tool_2->resource_1;tool_3->resource_2;tool_4->resource_3; closing[label="Go Forth, Make Something Fun", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#A7C7E7", color="#A7C7E7", fontcolor="#333333"];main->closing;}
